noun.description: The action of consenting to receive or undertake something offered.
examples: charges involving the acceptance of bribes
he had an acceptance from the magazine

noun.description: The action or process of being received as adequate or suitable, typically to be admitted into a group.
examples: you must wait for acceptance into the club

noun.description: Agreement with or belief in an idea, opinion, or explanation.
examples: acceptance of the teaching of the Church

origin: Mid 16th century: from Old French, from accepter (see accept).
